alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 08 at 1:26PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 324 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, Riverside. * WHEN...Until 324 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 126 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area of Coachella Valley. Between 0.1 and 0.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Indio, Palm Springs, Coachella, Mt San Jacinto State Park, Cathedral City, Palm Desert, Desert Hot Springs, Rancho Mirage, Hwy 74 Between Anza And Palm Desert and Thermal. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
